alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 06 at 3:52AM PST until February 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 10 and 18 inches possible above 3500 feet. * WHERE...Stevens Pass, Stehekin, and Holden Village. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Motorists should anticipate winter driving conditions at Stevens Pass Tuesday and Tuesday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow during the day Tuesday will be wet and heavy with temperatures in the 30s. Accumulation rates will increase Tuesday night with snow accumulating up to an inch per hour.
info.instruction: Check pass conditions before you leave and carry winter driving supplies like blankets, a shovel, water, food, and a cell phone charger. Make sure your car is winterized and in good working order.
